subject: Negotiation
title: The Power of Labeling
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Power of Labeling.

hook.text: Tell voters they're 'above-average citizens' and their turnout increases by 15%. Labels change behavior.

buildup.text: Labeling assigns an identity trait to someone â€” and people act to stay consistent with assigned labels.

discovery.text: FBI negotiators label emotions: 'It sounds like you're frustrated.' This makes people feel understood.

twist.text: Positive labels motivate. Negative labels alienate. Choose your words to shape the identity you want to reinforce.

climax.text: In negotiations, label the other side as reasonable, fair, or thoughtful â€” and watch them rise to it.

punchline.text: Call someone reasonable and they'll work hard to prove you right.

quiz.question: Why does labeling change people's behavior?
options: People act to stay consistent with the identity label assigned to them
